hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 20-day realized volatility falls below its 60-day realized volatility by more than 15% (compression) while price remains within a 5% range for 10+ days, the subsequent 5% breakout in either direction will correctly signal a new regime (BULL if up, BEAR if down) with 70% accuracy over the following 15 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility during neutral regimes represents pent-up energy. Breakouts from tight ranges often initiate sustained directional moves as new information gets priced in. Current neutral regime (61.5% confidence) with regulatory news creating potential catalysts.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above (10D high + 0.5%) OR below (10D low - 0.5%)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout direction reverses (long: close below entry breakout level; short: close above entry breakout level)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction fails to sustain for >3 days or reverses within 15 days more than 30% of occurrences. Regime classification post-breakout shows no statistical difference from random.
